alert.note: Alert for Bastrop (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 8:49PM CDT until April 20 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop and Lee. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elgin, Giddings, Lexington, Dime Box, Fedor, Paige, Circle D-KC Estates, Tanglewood, Camp Swift, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Webberville, Manheim, Hills, Lincoln, Leo, Blue, Knobb Springs, McDade, Loebau and Serbin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
